blog.name: friendsafariserver
blog.title: Friend Safari!
blog.description:
Friend Safari is a SFW, OC-friendly, paragraph-style roleplay server for main series Pokémon games. From Kanto to Alola, the whole Pokémon world is your Cloyster! Members of this server are allowed a total of four played characters, with at least one required to be canonical.

The server is run by a team of five mods who you can learn more about via the mods page. We cultivate an easygoing and open atmosphere, with member comfort and happiness being our top priority.

All of the links are in the drop down menu under Rowlet, labeled Pokémon! Hovering over each Pokémon will tell you what page they link to!

summary: Welcome to the Friend Safari! Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region,...
body:
Welcome to the Friend Safari!

Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region, multiple modes for character interactions, and plenty of in-character events, ours is an active and welcoming group always looking for new members! To learn more about our server, head over to our rules!

Reblog this ad, stop by our blog and check us out!

Rules | Joining | Characters | Timeline

summary: Pokemon FanFiction Chapter 6 part 2: Can we do this?
title: Pokemon FanFiction Chapter 6 part 2: Can we do this?
body:
Alex sat up, it couldn’t be. Before he could really assess who, Igneel ran over to the door to try and open it.

“Wait! Igneel,” Alex said as he got out of his bed to try and grab the Charmander, “I’m not fully-

But the small lizard was faster and somehow managed to open the door, and Alex was standing up. In his boxers. In front of the red-headed girl Alex had only met yesterday. Standing at her door. He blushed red.

“I-I-I can leave and come back later,” she stammered, her hands covering her face.

He avoided her gaze and waved his hands in defense, “NO! PLEASE! Uhm, let me put some clothes on, stay right there…”

He closed the door quickly and glared at Igneel, who had already run over to the other side of the room and was playing with his mobile, totally oblivious to what he had just done. He sighed and put his hand on his face and slid down to the floor. Great…

After getting some clothes on and making his bed as fast as he could, Alex opened the door and let Bethany in. The small golden lizard ran over and hugged Bethany’s leg as a greeting. She picked him up and hugged him,

“Glad to see you’re okay,” she whispered to him as Igneel rubbed his face onto hers and purred.

Even though it was a whisper, Alex heard it and looked down in shame and sat on his bed.

She noticed that, and she looked deeply into him with her soft deep green eyes before speaking, “I wanted to apologize. Not for letting the Headmistress know, because we both know that needed to happen before it got worse, but I wanted to apologize for not being there for you. I’m guessing last night was pretty rough for you, and I’m sorry I wasn’t a good friend to you.”

He tensed and put his hands together, “It’s fine. You wouldn’t want to work with a ‘noob’ of a trainer anyway, I understand.”

She sat down on the bed next to him, “Who said you were a noob trainer?”

“Me. I’m not good at this… maybe I shouldn’t be a trainer,” tears started to well in his eyes, and he looked up at her, “Maybe I’m in the wrong degree… I’m not good at this. I don’t deserve to be in this school. I don’t deserve Igneel… maybe I should-

She slapped him across the face, light but still hard enough for Alex to feel it,

“Alex, stop,” she looked away after the slap, tears forming under her green eyes, “That was your first real trainer battle and not many people can say they won their first. Plus, the biggest reason why you lost was because you weren’t yourself in that battle.”

He titled his head in confusion, “Myself?”

“Yeah. Alex, I was the one with the Pidgeot in the simulation yesterday at the library. I saw the way you took your time that entire time limit, I saw the way you were analyzing your moves, and everything in that simulation.”

She pointed her finger at him and poked him in the chest, “Why aren’t you taking your over-analysis skills and applying them to real life battles.”

He rubbed his eyes as he contemplated this thought. What did she mean by that? Regardless he shook his head,

“But what if I’m still not good enough Bethany?”

“Boy, then you will keep moving. You need to understand that its okay to lose, and that sometimes it can make you stronger. Igneel is still alive and you learned your lesson, that’s what should matter.”

He sighed and started to argue with what she said, but before he could think more into that she continued,

“You need to look deeper into your opponents, deeper into the Pokémon themselves rather than just the type and what effects them; you also need to better evaluate your own Pokémon, like here watch this,”

She pulled out an odd shaped rectangle object from her pocket with a cord attached to it and plugged it into her phone. She then whistled over for Igneel to come over and handed it to him,

“Please don’t chew this Igneel,” she said to the Charmander.

Igneel looked annoyed and opened his mouth in defiance, but when he looked at his trainer who was glaring at him, daring him to try him, he sulked and held it begrudgingly.  

“Look, you only used ember and scratch against that battle with Weedle. True the string shot web thing was cool, but it was something Igneel could’ve easily overcome if you knew what moves your Charmander was born knowing how to use,”

She typed in a couple codes onto her phone as Alex was looking over her shoulder at her phone, “This is how I evaluated my Pokemon and how I overlook her moves and stats. True its still a protype and the Pokemon has to hold it so it can scan what it actually is born knowing, but hey it is always accurate.”

The screen lit up and a bunch of words popped onto the screen, “I’ll give you this since you have such a basic data sheet on your Charmander, this will give you a better sense of Igneel and his potential.” She clicked share on the top of the screen and sent it to Alex’s phone.

Alex pulled up his phone, looked at the attachment, and gasped. The information here was astounding! There was so much more than Alex had ever thought of before, not to mention the fact that Igneel knew way more moves than he thought!

“See, your Charmander was born from an egg by two researchers that are very well known in the Unova region, so of course Igneel has a wide variety of moves you didn’t know were possible for a Charmander at this level.”

She put her phone back into her pocket and started to get up, “Now, I’ll leave you alone for now, but I expect to see you tomorrow afternoon. I still need a partner for the tournament that’s in three days,” she looked down, “I mean, if you still want to that is…”

Alex looked up from his phone full of information for him to strategize with, noticed her sad face and made a puckered face, “Maybe I overreacted a little bit. I guess Ill see you tomorrow for practice.”

She smiled at him and was about to say something, when instead Alex interjected with excitement,

“WAIT! Does that mean you are going to show me your starting Pokémon?”

She smiled at him and rolled her eyes, “Good question. Guess you’ll find out tomorrow if you come to the cafeteria for lunch.”

“Wait what does that mean? Bethany am I going to see your starting Pokemon!?” He teased as she grabbed her red jacket and pulled her hair back into a bun, ignoring him.

As she walked away and was at the door she was quickly stopped by a hug from behind. Her face blushed red as she realized it was from Alex. He felt warm and comforting, but she could also feel tears on the back of her neck. She gasped a little bit and froze.

“Thank you.”

She smiled and blushed, what a freak, she tried to tell herself.

But the small lizard was faster and somehow managed to open the door, and Alex was standing up. In his boxers. In front of the red-headed girl Alex had only met yesterday. Standing at her door. He blushed red.

“I-I-I can leave and come back later,” she stammered, her hands covering her face.

He avoided her gaze and waved his hands in defense, “NO! PLEASE! Uhm, let me put some clothes on, stay right there…”

He closed the door quickly and glared at Igneel, who had already run over to the other side of the room and was playing with his mobile, totally oblivious to what he had just done. He sighed and put his hand on his face and slid down to the floor. Great…

After getting some clothes on and making his bed as fast as he could, Alex opened the door and let Bethany in. The small golden lizard ran over and hugged Bethany’s leg as a greeting. She picked him up and hugged him,

“Glad to see you’re okay,” she whispered to him as Igneel rubbed his face onto hers and purred.

Even though it was a whisper, Alex heard it and looked down in shame and sat on his bed.

She noticed that, and she looked deeply into him with her soft deep green eyes before speaking, “I wanted to apologize. Not for letting the Headmistress know, because we both know that needed to happen before it got worse, but I wanted to apologize for not being there for you. I’m guessing last night was pretty rough for you, and I’m sorry I wasn’t a good friend to you.”

He tensed and put his hands together, “It’s fine. You wouldn’t want to work with a ‘noob’ of a trainer anyway, I understand.”

She sat down on the bed next to him, “Who said you were a noob trainer?”

“Me. I’m not good at this… maybe I shouldn’t be a trainer,” tears started to well in his eyes, and he looked up at her, “Maybe I’m in the wrong degree… I’m not good at this. I don’t deserve to be in this school. I don’t deserve Igneel… maybe I should-

She slapped him across the face, light but still hard enough for Alex to feel it,

“Alex, stop,” she looked away after the slap, tears forming under her green eyes, “That was your first real trainer battle and not many people can say they won their first. Plus, the biggest reason why you lost was because you weren’t yourself in that battle.”

He titled his head in confusion, “Myself?”

“Yeah. Alex, I was the one with the Pidgeot in the simulation yesterday at the library. I saw the way you took your time that entire time limit, I saw the way you were analyzing your moves, and everything in that simulation.”

She pointed her finger at him and poked him in the chest, “Why aren’t you taking your over-analysis skills and applying them to real life battles.”

He rubbed his eyes as he contemplated this thought. What did she mean by that? Regardless he shook his head,

“But what if I’m still not good enough Bethany?”

“Boy, then you will keep moving. You need to understand that its okay to lose, and that sometimes it can make you stronger. Igneel is still alive and you learned your lesson, that’s what should matter.”

He sighed and started to argue with what she said, but before he could think more into that she continued,

“You need to look deeper into your opponents, deeper into the Pokémon themselves rather than just the type and what effects them; you also need to better evaluate your own Pokémon, like here watch this,”

She pulled out an odd shaped rectangle object from her pocket with a cord attached to it and plugged it into her phone. She then whistled over for Igneel to come over and handed it to him,

“Please don’t chew this Igneel,” she said to the Charmander.

Igneel looked annoyed and opened his mouth in defiance, but when he looked at his trainer who was glaring at him, daring him to try him, he sulked and held it begrudgingly.  

“Look, you only used ember and scratch against that battle with Weedle. True the string shot web thing was cool, but it was something Igneel could’ve easily overcome if you knew what moves your Charmander was born knowing how to use,”

She typed in a couple codes onto her phone as Alex was looking over her shoulder at her phone, “This is how I evaluated my Pokemon and how I overlook her moves and stats. True its still a protype and the Pokemon has to hold it so it can scan what it actually is born knowing, but hey it is always accurate.”

The screen lit up and a bunch of words popped onto the screen, “I’ll give you this since you have such a basic data sheet on your Charmander, this will give you a better sense of Igneel and his potential.” She clicked share on the top of the screen and sent it to Alex’s phone.

Alex pulled up his phone, looked at the attachment, and gasped. The information here was astounding! There was so much more than Alex had ever thought of before, not to mention the fact that Igneel knew way more moves than he thought!

“See, your Charmander was born from an egg by two researchers that are very well known in the Unova region, so of course Igneel has a wide variety of moves you didn’t know were possible for a Charmander at this level.”

She put her phone back into her pocket and started to get up, “Now, I’ll leave you alone for now, but I expect to see you tomorrow afternoon. I still need a partner for the tournament that’s in three days,” she looked down, “I mean, if you still want to that is…”

Alex looked up from his phone full of information for him to strategize with, noticed her sad face and made a puckered face, “Maybe I overreacted a little bit. I guess Ill see you tomorrow for practice.”

She smiled at him and was about to say something, when instead Alex interjected with excitement,

“WAIT! Does that mean you are going to show me your starting Pokémon?”

She smiled at him and rolled her eyes, “Good question. Guess you’ll find out tomorrow if you come to the cafeteria for lunch.”

“Wait what does that mean? Bethany am I going to see your starting Pokemon!?” He teased as she grabbed her red jacket and pulled her hair back into a bun, ignoring him.

As she walked away and was at the door she was quickly stopped by a hug from behind. Her face blushed red as she realized it was from Alex. He felt warm and comforting, but she could also feel tears on the back of her neck. She gasped a little bit and froze.

“Thank you.”

She smiled and blushed, what a freak, she tried to tell herself.
